Literature Review: Ultra-high-energy gamma-ray astronomy has witnessed significant advancements in recent years, driven by the discovery of 12 PeVatrons and the detection of photons above 1 PeV. The detection of UHE γ-rays has opened a new window for observing celestial objects, with nearly all known sources emitting in the TeV band also emitting UHE photons. This review aims to provide an overview of the current state of ultra-high-energy gamma-ray astronomy, highlighting the challenges and opportunities in detecting and studying UHE γ-rays.
